Desk companion

Project Overview

My desk companion was a playful test into combining computer science and art. I wanted to make some sort of desk companion using electronic components and 3D printing.

The Process

I started by designing on my iPad in Procreate, creating the initial concept and aesthetic vision for my companion. Once I had a clear direction, I moved to Fusion360 where I created a negative model to fit all the computer components perfectly.

Next, I 3D modeled in NomadSculpt around the negative to match both the 3D sketch and ensure everything fit the electronic components snugly. After modeling, I assembled the electronics to test if it would work—and it did!

I created animations in Aseprite and uploaded the code to the ESP32 microcontroller. Finally, I assembled everything together and it worked great!

Tech Stack

  • ESP32 microcontroller
  • 3D Printing (Fusion360, NomadSculpt)
  • Digital Art (Procreate)
  • Animation (Aseprite)
  • Electronics assembly & programming
